abuse: Your enthusiasm; your ability to sell; your optimism.
goal: Authority and prestige; various symbols of prestige.
influence_others_by: Friendly behavior; frankness; ability in verbal expression.
its_value_for: He knows how to sell and close deals; delegate responsibilities; serene, self-confidence.
judge_others_by: Your verbal expression capacity; its flexibility.
more_effective_if: Tasks that are challenging will be assigned to you; pay more attention to service and key elemental details for the job; make an objective analysis of the information.

The persuasive works with and through others. That is, it strives to do business in a friendly manner while striving to achieve its own goals. The Persuasive, being frank by nature and showing interest in people, earns the respect and trust of various types of people. Persuasive has the ability to convince others of his point of view, he not only conquers them, he also retains them as clients or friends. This skill is particularly helpful to them in gaining positions of authority by selling themselves and their ideas.

Working with people, challenging tasks, and a variety of jobs and activities involving mobility provide a favorable environment for the Persuasive. Also, she often looks for work assignments that give her opportunities to look good. As a result of his natural enthusiasm, the persuasive tends to be overly optimistic about the results of projects and the potential of other people. The Persuasive also often overestimates his ability to change the behavior of others.

While rejecting routines and regulations, Persuasive needs to be provided with analytical information on a systematic and regular basis. When made aware of the importance of “little details,” the right information helps them balance their enthusiasm with a realistic assessment of the situation.
